Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2008 12:29PM Lucy47 wrote: Hi Ladies, I finished my last chemo Apr. 3rd '08....and by the end of June was no longer wearing my wig and actually went out to dinner with my dh. I must have had about 1/4 inch growth, but to my surprise no on gave me a 2nd look. I also coloured my hair two weeks later with a hair dye (28 shampoos) it worked great. I have now since coloured it 2 more times and it is about 1 inch in length. (coming in slightly curly). It feels good to have hair again....I didn't realize how much I missed it. good luck to you all still on chemo

But ladies I do know what you are saying about moving on after bc. I just started back to my fitness center and actually did 4 classes this week. Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2008 02:33AM Lucy47 wrote: ccdh, I know this all seems a bit confusing....I too had a lumpectomy last year and they got all the cancer and no nodes were involved. But because of the size of the tumor I was told that my best opinion would be to have chemo/rads/Tamoxifen. This is all to prevent recurrence. My understanding is that cancer cells are very sneaky, even though it may seem that they got everything. The chemo/rads kill off any possibility of any cancer that may have been missed. Tamoxifen is for estrogen fed tumors and it blocks the estrogen...it can put you into menopause but if you check these boards you will find that a lot of young women did get their periods back. As for numbness ...yes it is true. I am 13 months past surgery and just now have been getting back the feeling in my arm pit and also upper breast. Yes to being able to shave, but try and use an electric shaver...so as not to have any cuts that could result into a infection. Hope this helps. Good luck to you sorry you had to join us
Posts.Title: Just had lumpectomy and still confused ccdh MBrads

Posts.Title: Benign biopsies-should I get lump removed? gstf344 Lucy47

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2008 11:45AM Lucy47 wrote: Hi gstf.... I just found your post and I also see how very young you are. I too found a lump in my breast last Oct. ran to the doctor, she sent me running to a surgeon who quickly order mammogram, ultrasound and then biopsy. Two weeks after the biopsy the results came back neg. to cancer, but my surgeon had already scheduled surgery and he also doesn't believe in keeping any solid mass in the breast. Well when I woke up after surgery I was told it was cancer...... I'm not saying this is the same for you. I'm much older than you  (48 yrs old). Plus I was per-menopause....but if you are worried and this is causing you stress, you need to do what feels right for you. Good luck Lucy
Posts.Title: Benign biopsies-should I get lump removed? gstf344 Lucy47

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2008 10:40AM Lucy47 wrote: Thank you for the greetings... Yes I am finished, last radiation June 3, 2008 and am taking tomoxifen. I have a short but full head of hair now. My eyelashes have come back and my eyebrows have filled in. I just went to my family doctor yesterday, for a pap smear. I was getting traces of old blood, they say its's due to the tomoxifen but better be safe than sorry.....I also have a ultrasound on friday to check uterus lining. I think I'm doing well, but I have my days...which I don't let anyone see or know. Cancer is a very lonely place. I 'am the youngest of 6 and have 4 sisters. No one in my family has ever had cancer ( lucky me). I take good care of myself ...never smoked, have a drink every so often, eat right, exercise  and am at a normal weight. I wish I knew what else I could have done to prevent this....I'm also scared for my daughters, I feel that I've let them down. The doctors say there is no answers....one of my sisters seems to think it's because of the cleaning products I have in my house ( she's an idiot) I told her if that was the case then every house hold in the country would have cancer.
